title: A barrage and a midair explosion: What visual evidence shows about the Gaza hospital blast
description: Videos analyzed by The Washington Post reveal that rockets were launched from Gaza in the direction of al-Ahli Hospital 44 seconds before an explosion there.

title: ‘Nowhere safe’: In southern Gaza, a scramble in vain to outrun the war
description: As Israel’s attacks widen across Gaza, there are fewer and fewer places to hide.

title: A family taken by Hamas
description: More than 200 people were taken hostage by Hamas on Oct. 7, according to Israeli authorities. On today’s “Post Reports,” we hear about one family’s ordeal, and what the hostage crisis means for Israel’s possible ground invasion of Gaza.

title: Video shows Chinese jet flying within 10 feet of B-52, U.S. says
description: The nighttime incident involved a Chinese J-11 fighter closing in quickly on the U.S. Air Force B-52, passing in front of and below the American jet’s wing.

title: Israel raids Gaza with tanks; U.N. says ‘nowhere is safe’ for civilians
description: The Israeli incursion came a day after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the expected ground offensive could come at any time.

title: An Israeli passport in a bloody minibus leads to a Bedouin community in fear
description: Among the dead in the Oct. 7 Hamas attack were some members of Arab Bedouin communities in Israel. But they fear backlash by even talking about the war.

title: How the Israel-Gaza conflict is unfolding in maps, graphics and videos
description: This week has brought fear, destruction and uncertainty for millions in the region. Here’s how the events unfolded.

title: See how Israel’s siege has plunged Gaza into darkness and isolation
description: Without power, Palestinians have been deprived of their most basic needs.

title: At least 27 dead after Hurricane Otis batters Acapulco
description: Mexican Security Minister Rosa Icela Rodriguez said at least four people were also still missing in Acapulco.

title: European bans on pro-Palestinian protests and slogans test free speech
description: Critics question whether the restrictions — in France, Germany, Austria and elsewhere — reflect real safety concerns or government bias and overreach.

title: In photos: The scene after Otis slammed into Acapulco as a category 5 hurricane
description: Hurricane Otis, a tropical storm that strengthened suddenly into the most powerful cyclone known to have hit Mexico’s Pacific Coast, slammed into the tourist resort of Acapulco on Wednesday and battered nearby beach communities.

title: China’s foreign minister is in Washington. That counts as progress.
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and national security adviser Jake Sullivan will want to talk about the conflict between Israel and Hamas, but Wang Yi has a different agenda.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Netanyahu says Israel is ‘preparing for a ground incursion’
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he won’t specify details of an assault. A U.N. aid organization began to reduce operations in Gaza.

title: Russia prison population plummets as convicts are sent to war
description: To replenish its forces in Ukraine, Russia’s Defense Ministry has enlisted thousands of convicts, offering pardons in exchange for military service.

title: Why hasn’t Israel’s Gaza offensive started yet?
description: Israeli leaders have good reason to be cautious about rushing into urban warfare with Hamas.

title: Family of Al Jazeera Gaza bureau chief killed in airstrike
description: While reporting from the ground in Gaza, Wael Dahdouh learned that four family members had been killed in what Al Jazeera, the outlet he works for, said was an Israeli strike.

title: Biden weighs striking Iranian proxies after attacks on U.S. troops
description: President Biden said Wednesday that he warned Iran’s leaders the United States would respond if Tehran does not halt a spate of proxy attacks on American troops.

title: U.S., Russia veto each other’s U.N. resolutions on Israel-Gaza war
description: At the U.N. Security Council, Washington charged Moscow with ‘bad faith’ while Russia said the U.S. wanted to ‘green light’ Israel’s ground invasion of Gaza.
